entities.name: extendable ears
entities.description: A device used to listen in on conversations, described as having long, flesh-coloured strings.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione's reaction to the extendable ears is one of excitement and enthusiasm.

entities.name: ron weasley
entities.description: Ron is described as unraveling the strings of the extendable ears and feeding them towards the bottom of the door.

entities.name: imperturbable
entities.description: A term used to describe a door that is resistant to change or disturbance.

entities.name: malfoy
entities.description: Malfoy's voice can be heard through the extendable ears, and he is described as being unwilling to commit himself to fixing an issue.

entities.name: borgin
entities.description: Borgin is a shopkeeper who is hesitant to help Malfoy fix an issue without seeing it in person.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Harry observes Borgin's nervous behavior and interprets Malfoy's tone as indicating that he is not telling the truth.

relationships.description: Malfoy asks Borgin for help in fixing an issue, but Borgin is hesitant to commit himself without seeing it in person.
Harry observes Borgin's nervous behavior when talking to Malfoy.
